topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5ed096368721c5a0f0100#post_53a5ed096368721c5a0f0100
[bq="Randomosaur"]"@Zennistrad":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5616163687246cc920000#post_53a5616163687246cc920000
I like ponies but I hate Pokemon. I am quite torn.[/bq]
I'm probably going to get a ton of shit for this, but I'm with you on this.  I don't like pokemon.

What I would like to see from a monster capture game is a combination of pokemon and digimon and add in a bit of real time battles to it.  What I mean by this is like how with digimon there's a couple basic baby digimon to which they then digivolve into a assortment of possible rookies to which then they have a wider assortment of champions and a even wider assortment of ultimates and megavolutions.  So only like one or two starters total to which they then evolve into say thirty possible tier two evolutions each then each of those can evolve into say three or so tier three evolutions each then two or so tier four evolutions.  It would make it so if you don't feel like going out and getting monsters by backtracking you can just raise the one you want.

Also real time environment battles.
Anime:
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/639/793/d61.gif!
Actual battles in the games:
!http://25.media.tumblr.com/17d44e2a3da264785a406c796cadfee0/tumblr_mgb1pabo5c1r3ifxzo1_500.gif!
That's just straight up false advertisement guys.  Admit it folks would totally jizz all over the walls if the pokemon games were actually like this clip of scyther vs onix.

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53a5f2156368721be3300300#post_53a5f2156368721be3300300
Correction turn based fixed environment RPG; which is a niche market that a lot of people don't like.  There's a big difference between pokemon and say xcom which both fit under the turn based rpg umbrella.

What I would like in a monster capture game personally is a real time dynamic environment rpg instead; something where your monster can run around using the environment in battle in real time.
